org.jsimpledb

Class JSimpleDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsimpledb.JSimpleDB

  • public class JSimpleDB
extends Object
    Abstraction layer allowing access to a Database using normal Java objects.

    This class provides a natural, Java-centric view on top of the core Database class. This is done via two main enhancements to the functionality provided by Database:

    • Java annotations are used to define all Database objects and fields, to automatically register various listeners, and to define methods that access indexed fields.
    • Database objects and fields are represented using actual Java model objects, where the Java model classes are automatically generated subclasses of the user-supplied Java bean model classes. That is, in the view that a JSimpleDB provides, all Database object references (which are all ObjId objects) are replaced by normal Java model objects of the appropriate type, and all Database fields are accessible through the corresponding model objects' Java bean getter and setter methods, instead of directly through a Transaction object.

    In addition, a JSimpleDB provides automatic incremental JSR 303 validation.

    This class guarantees that for each ObjId it will only create a single, globally unique, Java model object. Therefore, the same Java model objects can be used in and out of any transaction, and can serve as unique database object identifiers (if you have not overridden equals() in your model clases). Except for their associated ObjIds, the generated Java model objects are stateless; all database field state is contained within whichever transaction is associated with the current thread. All generated Java model classes will implement the JObject interface.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JSimpleDB

        public JSimpleDB(Iterable<Class<?>> classes)
        Create an instance using an initially empty, in-memory SimpleKVDatabase. This constructor can also be used just to validate the given classes.
        Parameters:
        classes - classes annotated with JSimpleClass and/or JFieldType annotations
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if classes is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if classes contains a null class or a class with invalid annotation(s)
        InvalidSchemaException - if the schema implied by classes is invalid

      • JSimpleDB

        public JSimpleDB(Database database,
         int version,
         Iterable<Class<?>> classes)
        Primary constructor.
        Parameters:
        database - core database to use
        version - schema version number of the schema derived from classes
        classes - classes annotated with JSimpleClass and/or JFieldType annotations
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parameter is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if version is not greater than zero
        IllegalArgumentException - if classes contains a null class or a class with invalid annotation(s)
        InvalidSchemaException - if the schema implied by classes is invalid

    • Method Detail

      • createTransaction

        public JTransaction createTransaction(boolean allowNewSchema,
                             ValidationMode validationMode)
        Create a new transaction. This does not invoke JTransaction.setCurrent(): the caller is responsible for doing that if necessary.
        Parameters:
        allowNewSchema - whether creating a new schema version is allowed
        validationMode - the ValidationMode to use for the new transaction
        Throws:
        org.jsimpledb.InvalidSchemaException - if schemaModel does not match what's recorded in the database for the schema version provided to the constructor
        org.jsimpledb.InvalidSchemaException - if the schema version provided to the constructor is not recorded in the database and allowNewSchema is false
        org.jsimpledb.InvalidSchemaException - if the schema version provided to the constructor is not recorded in the database and allowNewSchema is true, but schemaModel is incompatible with one or more previous schemas alread recorded in the database (i.e., the same storage ID is used incompatibly between schema versions)
        org.jsimpledb.InconsistentDatabaseException - if inconsistent or invalid schema information is detected in the database
        IllegalArgumentException - if validationMode is null

        public SchemaModel getSchemaModel()
        Get the SchemaModel associated with this instance, derived from the annotations on the scanned classes.

      • getJObject

        public JObject getJObject(ObjId id)
        Get the Java object used to represent the given object ID.

        This method guarantees that for any particular id, the same Java instance will always be returned.

        Parameters:
        id - object ID
        Returns:
        Java model object

        public ReferencePath parseReferencePath(TypeToken<?> startType,
                               String path)
        Parse a ReferencePath in String form.
        Parameters:
        startType - starting Java type for the path
        path - dot-separated path of zero or more reference fields, followed by a target field
        Throws:

        IllegalArgumentException - if startType or path is null
